Hitler's figure always has impressed me since I was a child with a singular and strange kind of fascination. It never changed even with all the bad propaganda about him. Now, in a more mature age, I can understand the why of this with a much wider perception. The answer came when I first read the interpretation Jung made of Hitler. According to him Hitler wasn't a person anymore. He was, in a sense, a non-person. He was the channel of the Collective Unconscious of the whole German people, the manifestation of the Nordic god Wotan (which means the same thing). Therefore, he speaks directly through us and for us. Even the German born out of German feels compelled by his voice, even don't understanding a single word of him, because his connection goes deeper than rationality. When Rudolf Hess said "Hitler is Germany, and Germany is Hitler" he wasn't only using a jargon, he was telling some deep truth.
